      • toggleAnimations

        public static android.widget.BaseAdapter toggleAnimations(boolean enable,
                                          android.widget.ListView lv,
                                          SingleAnimationAdapter animAdapter,
                                          android.widget.BaseAdapter defaultAdapter)
        Enables or disables listview animations. This simply toggles the adapter, initialising a new adapter if necessary.
        Parameters:
        enable - Whether to enable animations on the listview
        Returns:
        The outer-most adapter that was applied to the list view. a non-null instance of animAdapter if enable, defaultAdapter otherwise.

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected(android.content.Context context)
        Queries the active network and determine if it has Internet connectivity.
        Parameters:
        context - Application or activity context
        Returns:
        Whether we are connected to the internet, regardless of the network type

      • prettyPrintDateTime

        public static String prettyPrintDateTime(android.content.Context context,
                         String date,
                         TimeZone serverTimeZone,
                         TimeZone localTimeZone)
        PrettyPrint the Gerrit provided timestamp format into a more human readable format I have no clue what the ten zeros after the seconds are good for as the exact same ten zeros are in all databases regardless of the stamp's time or timezone... it comes from Google so we just handle oddities downstream :( from "2013-06-09 19:47:40.000" to Jun 09, 2013 07:47 40ms PM
        Returns:
        String representation of the date example: Jun 09, 2013 07:47 40ms PM

      • parseIgnoreCacheHeaders

        public static Cache.Entry parseIgnoreCacheHeaders(NetworkResponse response,
                                  long cacheRefreshTime,
                                  long cacheExpiresTime)
        Extracts a com.android.volley.Cache.Entry from a com.android.volley.NetworkResponse. Cache-control headers are ignored.
        Parameters:
        response - The network response to parse headers from
        Returns:
        a cache entry for the given response, or null if the response is not cacheable.
